captions.text:
CARTER [IN VOlCEOVER] :
Edward Perríman Cole díed ín May.

lt was a Sunday afternoon,
and there wasn't a cloud ín the sky.

lt's díffícult to understand
the sum of a person's lífe.

Some people wíll tell you ít's measured
by the ones left behínd.

Some belíeve ít can be measured
ín faíth.
Some say by love.

Other folks say lífe has
no meaníng at all.
Me?
l belíeve that you measure yourself...

...by the people who
measured themselves by you.

What l can tell you for sure
ís that. by any measure...

...Edward Cole líved more ín hís last
days on Earth...

...than most people manage
to wríng out of a lífetíme.

l know that when he díed.
hís eyes were closed...
...and hís heart was open.

MAN 1 : ''Name the five presidents whose
Iast names begin with the letter H.''
H?

Warren G. Harding.
Rutherford B. Hayes. Herbert Hoover...

...and the two Harrisons.
Benjamin and William Henry.
Ah.

Thought l'd get you
with the double Harrisons.

CARTER: Ha-ha-ha.
-You're sick. you know?

You think that's sick.
can you name their wives?

-No.
-Neither can l.

MAN 2: Yo. Cartey-car!
CARTER: Yo!

-When they need the Camaro. man?
-Yesterday.

MAN 2:
Huh?

-All right. l got one for you.
CARTER: All right.
Who invented the radio?
Ah.
That's a hard one.

-What do you know. l finally got you.
CARTER: No.

l don't know if you want who
they think invented the radio...

...or the person who
actually invented the radio.
Well. in here it says--
Marconi. right?
Yeah. it ain't him?

title: The Bucket List Official Trailer #1 - (2007) HD

comments.text: Great movie ﻿
comments.author: Menno Ligtvoet

comments.text:
Loved the film, laughed and cried to it, enjoyed every second and every 
performance! BUT it is Soooo SAD, it's a plagiarism from Barry Gibb's 
"HAWKS" film from 1988. It was all over the news, then it was gone, maybe 
they came to an arrangement!﻿
comments.author: schwarverick

comments.text:
8/10. If Rotten Tomatoes has ever messed up on rating a film, it would be 
"The Bucket List". They ranked it at 40%, it should be in the high 60's to 
low 80's. Jack Nicholson and Morgan Freeman have great chemistry together 
(who would of thunk?). Has some very good chuckle moments, tear jerkers and 
life lessons. Very high "rewatchability" on this movie. If you are a Morgan 
Freeman or Jack Nicholson fan and haven't seen this yet, do yourself a 
favor and get it immediately. A DVD collection wouldn't be complete without 
"The Bucket List".﻿

comments.text:
This movie didn't get a lot of great buzz from critics. I agree that they 
could have done something to make it better, but I still like the movie. 
It's got a great message, and they share good chemistry. This film got me 
to change my life. After watching this movie, and the show, The Buried 
Life, I decided to make my own bucket list. I have come up with so many 
ideas, and need to come up with more. I'm open to many things, please reply 
to this by sharing some ideas that I should add to my bucket list! 😊﻿

comments.author: mohd 730

comments.text:
What a beautiful movie!! I absolutely love this so much!
To all those who are searching 'For the Joy in your life', I watched a 
documentary called "Happy" by Roko Belic and in it, it says that 'Happiness 
is intrinsic, searching for it in material goods will never work..."

Happiness is down to three things, 1, Self Betterment. i.e. Becoming better 
at your hobbies or work or better educating yourself and learing more about 
what facinates you. 2, Family and Friends. Human beings are social 
creatures, we strive for good company. Talk, share and listen to your loved 
ones! and 3, Doing good work without need for recognition. Help others just 
'cause they need it at that time, get involved with the community...

Spread the word! Be happy without the need to consume what is not necessary﻿
comments.author: MJPamuru20

comments.text:
I might be a bit biased as a bucket list blogger, but this movie has such a 
beautiful message. Can never watch it too many times :) I've started a 
series on my blog, where I ask strangers the #1 item they want to cross off 
their bucket list & they best thing they've ever accomplished in life. It's 
really helped me see how human beings may be different, but we all have 
similar hopes, desires, and stuff we're proud of.﻿

comments.text:
What Is Your Bucket List?

The other day my wife and I had a movie night...

...we watched the bucket list! It's a great and inspiring movie, which has 
led me to ask YOU this question:

"If time and money, would not be an issue, what would your life look like?
What would you have? Who would you be? What would you be doing?"

http://www.the-family-man.net/blog/movie-review-the-bucket-list﻿
